meanings.definition: A mark or design made by hand on an object.
meanings.sent1: The handstamp on the letter showed it was official.
meanings.sent2: She used a handstamp to put her initials on the document.
meanings.sent3: The handstamp on the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a handstamp of happiness on his face.
meanings.sent5: The handstamp on the map indicated the location of the treasure.

meanings.definition: To mark or stamp with a handstamp.
meanings.sent1: He carefully handstamped each envelope with the company logo.
meanings.sent2: Please handstamp the approval on the form before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: She handstamped the book with a heart symbol to show her love for reading.
meanings.sent4: The memory was handstamped in his mind forever.
meanings.sent5: The artist handstamped his signature on the painting.

meanings.definition: A device used for stamping or marking by hand.
meanings.sent1: The antique handstamp was used by craftsmen for years.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new handstamp for her art projects.
meanings.sent3: The handstamp was so old, it looked like a relic from the past.
meanings.sent4: The handstamp was a tool of precision in the hands of the artist.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design on the handstamp impressed everyone who saw it.
